intro: Tabernaemontana cuneata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Tabernaemontana cuneata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
